recipes.name: French Press
steps: Heat water to 93째C.
Grind coffee to a coarse consistency.
Add coffee grounds to the French Press.
Pour about 50ml of hot water to bloom the coffee and let it sit for 30 seconds.
Add the remaining water and stir gently.
Place the lid on and let the coffee steep for 4 minutes.
Slowly press down the plunger.
Pour immediately into a cup to prevent over-extraction and enjoy.

recipes.name: AeroPress
steps: Insert a paper filter into the AeroPress cap and rinse it with hot water.
Assemble the AeroPress on a cup or inverted if using the inverted method.
Add the ground coffee into the AeroPress chamber.
Pour 50ml of hot water and stir gently, allowing the coffee to bloom for 30 seconds.
Add the remaining water up to the top and stir again.
Place the plunger on top and wait for 1 minute.
Slowly press down the plunger over 20-30 seconds.
Enjoy as is, or add hot water to dilute for an Americano.

recipes.name: Pour-Over
steps: Place the paper filter into the V60 and rinse it with hot water.
Grind coffee to a medium consistency.
Add the coffee grounds to the V60.
Start with a 30ml pour to bloom the coffee and wait for 30-45 seconds.
Slowly pour water in circular motions in 3-4 stages.
Maintain a total brew time of 2:30 to 3:30 minutes.
Once dripping stops, remove the filter and serve.

recipes.name: Moka Pot
recipes.grind_size: Fine (but not as fine as espresso)

ingredients.water: Fill bottom chamber to the valve with hot water

steps: Fill the bottom chamber of the Moka Pot with hot water up to the valve.
Insert the filter basket and fill it evenly with coffee grounds without pressing.
Assemble the Moka Pot and place it on medium heat.
Watch for coffee to start flowing (~2 minutes), then reduce the heat.
When the pot starts sputtering, remove it from heat immediately.
Cool the base with a damp cloth to stop extraction.
Pour and enjoy as is or mix with milk.

recipes.name: Cold Brew
steps: Grind coffee to a coarse consistency.
Add coffee grounds to a jar or pitcher.
Pour cold or room-temperature water over the grounds.
Stir gently to ensure all grounds are saturated.
Cover and let steep in the refrigerator for 12-24 hours.
Strain the coffee using a fine mesh filter or cheesecloth.
Dilute with water or milk if desired and serve over ice.
